verses.text: If he is able to fight with me and to strike me down, then we will be your servants. But if I prevail against him and strike him down, then you will be our servants and will serve us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistine said, “I defy the battle lines of Israel this day. Give me a man, and let us fight together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul and all Israel heard these words of the Philistine, they were filled with terror and were greatly afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem in Judah whose name was Jesse, who had eight sons. And the man was old in the days of Saul and advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three eldest sons of Jesse went and followed Saul to the battle. And the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next to him Abinadab, and the third was Shammah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for David, he was the youngest. The three eldest followed Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but David would go back and forth from Saul to shepherd his father’s flock in Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistine stepped forward morning and evening and took his stand daily for forty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesse said to David his son, “Take now for your brothers an ephah of this parched grain and these ten loaves and run to the camp to your brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carry these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand, and look into your brothers’ health, and bring back news of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Saul, and they, and all Israel’s fighting men were in the Valley of Elah fighting with the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David rose up early in the morning and left the flock with a keeper. And he carried away the food and went as Jesse had commanded him. And when he came to the encampment, the army was going out to the battle line, and they shouted a war cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel and the Philistines ordered themselves in battle lines, army against army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David left his things with the keeper of the equipment, and he ran to the battle line. And he went and greeted his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was speaking with them, the champion, Goliath, the Philistine from Gath, was going up from the battle line of the Philistines. And he spoke these same words and David heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all Israel’s fighting men saw the man, they fled from him, and were very afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Israel said, “Have you seen this man who has come up? Surely he has come up to defy Israel, and it will be that the man who kills him, the king will enrich him with great riches, will give him his daughter, and will make his father’s house exempt from taxes in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David spoke to the men that stood by him, saying, “What will be done for the man that kills this Philistine and takes away this reproach from Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine that he should defy the armies of the living God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people answered him in the same way, saying, “So will it be done to the man who kills him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke to the men. And Eliab’s anger was kindled against David, and he said, “Why have you come down here? And with whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride and the evil of your heart. For you have come down that you might see the battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “What have I done now? Was it not only a word?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he turned from him toward another and spoke in the same way. And the people answered him again as at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the words which David spoke were heard, they reported them to Saul and he sent for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him. Your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him. For you are but a youth, and he has been a man of war from his youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Saul, “Your servant was a shepherd for my father’s flock, and the lion came and the bear, and took a lamb out of the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I went out after him, and struck him, and delivered it out of his mouth. And when he arose against me, I took hold of his beard, struck him, and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your servant slew both the lion and the bear. And this uncircumcised Philistine will be as one of them, because he has reviled the armies of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David said, “The Lord who delivered me out of the paw of the lion and out of the paw of the bear, He will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine.”
And Saul said to David, “Go, and the Lord be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul clothed David with his armor. And he put a helmet of bronze on his head. He also clothed him with a coat of mail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David secured his sword to his armor and tried to walk, but he was not used to it, for he had not tested them.
And David said to Saul, “I cannot walk with these, for I have not tested them.” So David took them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took his staff in his hand and chose for himself five smooth stones out of the brook. And he put them in his shepherd’s bag, even in a pouch. And his sling was in his hand. Then he drew near to the Philistine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistine came walking and drew near to David, and the man bearing the shield went before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Philistine looked and saw David, he despised him. For he was a youth and ruddy with a handsome appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistine said to David, “Am I a dog, that you come to me with sticks?” Then the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistine said to David, “Come to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the heavens and to the beasts of the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to the Philistine, “You come to me with a sword, a spear, and a shield, but I come to you in the name of the Lord of Hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have reviled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day will the Lord deliver you into my hand. And I will strike you down and cut off your head. Then I will give the corpses of the Philistine camp this day to the birds of the air and to the beasts of the earth so that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then all this assembly will know that it is not by sword and spear that the Lord saves. For the battle belongs to the Lord, and He will give you into our hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Philistine arose and came near to meet David, David hurried and ran toward the battle line to meet the Philistine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David put his hand in his bag and took from there a stone. And he slung it and struck the Philistine in his forehead. Therefore the stone sunk into his forehead and he fell upon his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone. And he struck down the Philistine and slew him, but there was no sword in the hand of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore David ran and stood over the Philistine. Then he took his sword and drew it from out of its sheath, and he finished him off and he cut off his head with it.
When the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fighting men of Israel and Judah arose and shouted. And they pursued the Philistines from the entrance of the Valley of Elah as far as the gates of Ekron. So the Philistine dead lay slain on the road to Shaaraim as far as Gath and Ekron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines and they plundered their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took the head of the Philistine and brought it to Jerusalem, but he put his armor in his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Saul saw David going out against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the commander of the army, “Whose son is this youth, Abner?”
And Abner said, “As your soul lives, O king, I do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said, “Inquire whose son the young man is.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when David returned from slaying the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him before Saul with the Philistine’s head in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul said to him, “Whose son are you, young man?”
And David answered, “I am the son of your servant, Jesse the Bethlehemite.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan was bound to the soul of David, so that Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul took him that day and would not permit him to return home to his father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant because he loved him as his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was on him and gave it to David, even his garments, his sword, his bow, and his belt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David went out wherever Saul sent him, and he was successful. So Saul set him over the men of war, and it was pleasing in the sight of all the people and also in the sight of the servants of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came home, as David was returning from slaying the Philistine, the women came out from all cities of Israel to meet King Saul, singing and dancing, with tambourines, with joy, and with musical instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The dancing women sang and said,
“Saul has slain his thousands,
    and David his ten thousands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul became very angry, and this saying was displeasing to him. Therefore he said, “They have ascribed to David ten thousands, but to me they have ascribed thousands. Now what remains for him to have but the kingdom?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul was suspicious of David from that day and forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came to pass the following day, that an evil spirit from God came upon Saul, so that he raved in the midst of the house. And David was playing the lyre, as at other times. Now there was a spear in Saul’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul threw the spear. For he said, “I will pin David to the wall.” But David avoided him two times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul was afraid of David because the Lord was with him but had departed from Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Saul removed him from his presence and placed him as his captain over a thousand. And he went out and came in before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was successful in all his ways and the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul saw that he was very successful, he was afraid of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all Israel and Judah loved David, because he went out and came in before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said to David, “Behold my elder daughter Merab, I will give her to you as your wife. Only be valiant for me, and fight the battles of the Lord.” For Saul said, “Let not my hand be against him, but let the hand of the Philistines be against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David said to Saul, “Who am I? And what is my life, or my father’s family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when it was time that Merab, daughter of Saul, should have been given to David, she was given to Adriel the Meholathite for a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Michal, daughter of Saul, loved David and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said, “I will give her to him that she may be a snare to him, and so that the hand of the Philistines may be against him.” Therefore Saul said to David, “For a second time, you may be my son-in-law today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul commanded his servants, saying, “Speak to David in secret saying, ‘Listen, the king delights in you and all his servants love you. Now therefore become the king’s son-in-law.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servants of Saul spoke these words in the ears of David. And David said, “Does it seem to you a light thing to be a king’s son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servants of Saul reported to him saying, “According to these words, David spoke.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said, “Thus will you say to David, ‘The king does not desire any dowry but a hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king’s enemies.’ ” But Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king’s son-in-law. Now the days had not expired;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore David arose and went, he and his men, and killed two hundred men of the Philistines. Then David brought their foreskins and they gave them in full to the king, that he might be the king’s son-in-law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter for a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul saw and knew that the Lord was with David, and that Michal, his daughter, loved him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul was yet the more afraid of David, and Saul became the enemy of David continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the commanders of the Philistines went out to make war. And when they went out David was more successful than all the servants of Saul, so that his name was highly honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul spoke to Jonathan, his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David. But Jonathan, Saul’s son, delighted very much in David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan told David, saying, “My father Saul seeks to kill you. Therefore, be on guard in the morning; stay in a secret place and hide yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where you are. Then I will speak about you to my father, and what I observe I will report to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan spoke positively of David to Saul his father and said to him, “Do not let the king sin against his servant, against David, because he has not sinned against you, and because his deeds have been very good toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he took his life in his hand and struck down the Philistine, and the Lord made a great salvation for all Israel. You saw it and rejoiced. Now why then would you sin against innocent blood, to kill David without cause?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul listened to the voice of Jonathan and Saul vowed, “As the Lord lives, he will not be killed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan called David, and Jonathan reported to him all these words. Then Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence as previously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was war again, and David went out and fought with the Philistines. He slew them with a great slaughter and they fled from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an evil spirit from the Lord was upon Saul as he was sitting in his house with his spear in his hand. And David was playing the lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul sought to pin David to the wall with the spear, but he escaped from Saul’s presence. He struck the spear into the wall. But David fled and escaped that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul also sent messengers to the house of David, to watch him and to slay him in the morning. But Michal, wife of David, told him, saying, “If you do not save your life tonight, tomorrow you will be dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Michal let David down through a window, and he went and fled to safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Michal took an idol and laid it in the bed, and put a braided goat hair pillow for its head and covered it with clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, “He is sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul sent the messengers again to see David, saying, “Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the messengers came in, there was the idol in the bed with a goat hair pillow for its head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul said to Michal, “Why have you betrayed me and sent away my enemy, so that he escaped?”
And Michal said to Saul, “He said to me, ‘Let me go. Why should I kill you?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David fled, and he escaped and came to Samuel at Ramah. And he reported to him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and stayed in Naioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was told Saul, saying, “David is at Naioth in Ramah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul sent messengers to take David, but when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying and Samuel taking his stand over them, the Spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul and they also prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was reported to Saul, he sent other messengers. And they also prophesied. So Saul sent messengers again a third time, and they too prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he also went to Ramah and came to the great well that is in Seku. And he asked and said, “Where are Samuel and David?”
And one said, “They are at Naioth in Ramah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went there to Naioth in Ramah, and the Spirit of God came upon him also. And he went on and he prophesied until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stripped off his clothes and he also prophesied before Samuel. And he lay down naked all that day and all that night. Therefore they say, “Is Saul also among the prophets?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, “What have I done? What is my offense? And what is my sin before your father, that he seeks my life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Far from it! You shall not die. Look, my father does nothing either great or small that he does not reveal to me. Why would my father hide this thing from me? It is not so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David vowed again and said, “Your father certainly knows that I have found favor in your sight. And he says, ‘Do not let Jonathan know this, lest he be distressed.’ However, as the Lord lives and as your soul lives, there is but a step between me and death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan said to David, “Whatever you say, I will do it for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Jonathan, “Tomorrow is the New Moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king to eat. But let me go that I may hide myself in the field until the evening of the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your father misses me at all, then say, ‘David asked for leave from me that he might run to Bethlehem his city, for there is a yearly sacrifice there for all the family.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he says, ‘Good,’ it will be well for your servant. But if he gets angry, know that evil is determined by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore deal kindly with your servant, for you have brought your servant into a covenant of the Lord with you. But if there is any guilt in me, kill me yourself. For why should you bring me to your father?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonathan said, “Far be it from you. For if I indeed knew that my father had determined evil against you, would I not tell it you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Jonathan, “Who will tell me? Or what if your father answers you roughly?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jonathan said to David, “Come, let us go out into the field.” And the two of them went out to the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonathan said to David, “The Lord God of Israel is witness. When I have sounded out my father about this time tomorrow, or by the third day, and if he is favorable toward David, then will I not send and reveal it to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord do so to Jonathan and much more. If it pleases my father to do you evil, then I will reveal it you and send you away that you may go in peace. And may the Lord be with you as He has been with my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I live, not only will you show me the kindness of the Lord, that I shall not die,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you will not cut off your faithfulness from my house forever, even when the Lord has cut off each one of the enemies of David from the face of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David saying, “May the Lord require it at the hand of the enemies of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan made David swear again, because he loved him. For he loved him as he loved his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonathan said to David, “Tomorrow is the New Moon, and you will be missed, because your seat will be empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have stayed three days, you will surely go down and come to the place where you hid yourself on the day this happened, and wait there beside the stone Ezel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will shoot three arrows to its side, as though I shot at a target.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will send a boy, saying, ‘Go, find the arrows.’ If I expressly say to the boy, ‘See, the arrows are on this side of you, take them,’ then come, for it will be safe for you. And as the Lord lives, it is nothing of concern.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I say to the young man, ‘See, the arrows are beyond you,’ go, for the Lord has sent you away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the matter upon which you and I have spoken, the Lord is between you and me forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David hid himself in the field. And when the New Moon appeared, the king sat down over food to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king sat on his seat, as at other times, even on a seat by the wall. Then Jonathan arose and Abner sat by Saul’s side, but David’s place was empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless Saul did not say anything that day. For he thought, “Something has happened. He is not clean; surely he is not clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened on the following day, which was the second day of the month, that David’s place remained empty. So Saul said to Jonathan his son, “Why has the son of Jesse not come to eat food either yesterday or today?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonathan answered Saul, “David earnestly asked leave from me to go to Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘Please let me go, for our family has a sacrifice in the city and my brother has commanded me to come. Now, if I have found favor in your sight, please let me leave and see my brothers.’ This is why he has not come to the king’s table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul was angry with Jonathan and he said to him, “You son of a perverse rebellious woman, do I not know that you are choosing the son of Jesse to your own shame, and to the shame of your mother’s nakedness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as long as the son of Jesse lives on the earth, neither you nor your kingdom will be established. Now, send and bring him to me, for he is a dead man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan answered Saul his father and said to him, “Why should he be killed? What has he done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul cast a spear at him to strike him. Therefore Jonathan knew that his father was determined to kill David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger and did not eat food on the second day of the month. For he was grieved for David, because his father had dishonored him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning Jonathan went out to the field at the time appointed with David, and a little boy was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his boy, “Run, find the arrows which I shoot.” He ran, and he shot the arrow over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the boy came to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan called after the boy and said, “Is not the arrow beyond you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonathan cried after the boy, “Hurry quickly! Do not stay!” And Jonathan’s boy gathered up the arrow and came to his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the boy did not know anything. Only Jonathan and David knew the matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan gave his weapons to his boy and said to him, “Go, carry them to the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the boy had gone, David arose from the south side of the stone, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times. They kissed one another and wept together, but David wept more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan said to David, “Go in peace, since the two of us swore in the name of the Lord, saying, ‘The Lord will be between me and you, and between my descendants and your descendants forever.’ ” So he arose and departed, but Jonathan went into the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David came to Nob to Ahimelek the priest. And Ahimelek trembled coming to meet David and said to him, “Why are you alone and no man is with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Ahimelek the priest, “The king commanded me a matter and said to me, ‘Let no man know anything of the business which I am sending you and what I have commanded you.’ But to the young men I made known a certain place to meet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore what is in your hand? Give me five loaves of bread in my hand, or whatever can be found.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest answered David and said, “There is no common bread at hand. But there is holy bread, if the young men have indeed been kept from women.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David answered the priest and said to him, “Indeed women have been kept from us. As previously, when I went out the vessels of the young men were holy even if it was an ordinary journey. How much more then today will their vessels be holy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priest gave him holy bread. For there was no bread there but the showbread that was removed from before the Lord, in order to place hot bread there on the day when it was taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the Lord. And his name was Doeg, the Edomite, chief of the shepherds of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Ahimelek, “Is there not a spear or a sword here at hand? For neither my sword nor my weapons did I bring with me, because the king’s business was urgent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The priest said, “The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you struck down in the Valley of Elah, is here, wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod. If you will take that, take it. For there is none other but that here.”
And David said, “There is none like it. Give it me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David arose and fled that day from Saul. And he went to Achish the king of Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The servants of Achish said to him, “Is this not David the king of the land? Did they not sing with dances for him, saying,
‘Saul has slain his thousands,
    and David his ten thousands’? ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took these words to heart and greatly feared Achish the king of Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he changed his behavior before them and pretended to be insane in their hands. And he scratched on the doors of the gate and let his spittle run down his beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Achish to his servants, “You see the man is acting like a madman. Why then have you brought him to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I one who lacks lunatics, that you brought this one to behave as a madman in my presence? Will this man come into my house?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David departed from there and escaped to the cave of Adullam. And when his brothers and all his father’s house heard it, they went down to him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There gathered to him every one that was in distress, and every one in debt, and every one that was discontented. So he became captain over them. Now there were with him about four hundred men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David went from there to Mizpah of Moab. And he said to the king of Moab, “Please let my father and my mother come forth and be with you until I know what God will do for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought them before the king of Moab, and they lived with him all the while that David was in the stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet Gad said to David, “Do not remain in the stronghold. Go to the land of Judah.” So David went and came to the forest of Hereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul heard that David and the men who were with him were discovered, Saul was sitting in Gibeah under the tamarisk tree on the hill with his spear in his hand. And all his servants were standing about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said to his servants that stood about him, “Hear now, Benjamites! Will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards? Will he appoint you all as captains of thousands and captains of hundreds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have all conspired against me, and no one revealed to me that my son made a covenant with the son of Jesse. And not one of you is grieved for me and revealed it to me that my son raised up my servant against me to ambush me as at this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Doeg the Edomite, who was chief over the servants of Saul, answered and said, “I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelek the son of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he inquired of the Lord for him and gave him provisions. And he gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king sent to summon Ahimelek the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father’s house, the priests that were in Nob. And they all came to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul said, “Hear now, son of Ahitub!”
And he answered, “Here I am, my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said to him, “Why have you conspired against me, you and the son of Jesse, in that you gave him bread and a sword, and have inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me to ambush me, as at this day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ahimelek answered the king and said, “And who is as faithful among all your servants as David, who is the king’s son-in-law, chief of your bodyguard, and is honored in your house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I just today begin to inquire of God for him? Far be it from me! Let not the king assign any blame to his servant, or to all the house of my father. For your servant has known nothing of all this matter, whether small or great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said, “You will surely die, Ahimelek, you and all your father’s house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king said to the guards standing near him, “Turn and kill the priests of the Lord, because their hand is with David. And because they knew that he was fleeing and did not reveal it to me.”
But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to attack the priests of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to Doeg, “You turn and fall upon the priests.” And Doeg the Edomite turned and struck the priests and killed on that day eighty-five men who wore a linen ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nob, the city of the priests, he struck with the edge of the sword. Both men and women, children and babies, oxen, donkeys, and sheep, he struck with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the sons of Ahimelek the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped and fled after David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abiathar reported to David that Saul had killed the priests of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Abiathar, “I knew it that day when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul. I have caused the death of all the persons of your father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain with me. Do not fear. For the one who seeks my life seeks your life, but you are safe with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told David, “Listen, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they are looting the threshing floors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore David inquired of the Lord, saying, “Shall I go and attack these Philistines?”
And the Lord said to David, “Go and attack the Philistines, and rescue Keilah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of David said to him, “We are afraid here in Judah. How much more then, if we go down to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David again inquired of the Lord. And the Lord answered him and said, “Arise, go down to Keilah because I am giving the Philistines into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David and his men went to Keilah. He fought with the Philistines and carried off their livestock, and he struck them with a great slaughter. So David rescued the inhabitants of Keilah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abiathar the son of Ahimelek fled to David at Keilah, he came down with the ephod in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was reported to Saul that David had come to Keilah. And Saul said, “God has delivered him into my hand. For he is shut in, by entering into a town that has gates and bars.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul summoned all the people together for war, to go down to Keilah to besiege David and his men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David found out that Saul was planning evil against him. So he said to Abiathar the priest, “Bring the ephod near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, “O Lord, God of Israel, Your servant has certainly heard that Saul seeks to come to Keilah, to destroy the city on account of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the leaders of Keilah deliver me into his hand? Will Saul come down, as Your servant has heard? O Lord, God of Israel, please tell Your servant.”
And the Lord said, “He will come down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then said David, “Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul?”
And the Lord said, “They will deliver you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and his men, which were about six hundred, arose and left Keilah. And they went wherever they could go. Now it was told Saul that David had escaped from Keilah. So he halted the expedition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David remained in the wilderness in strongholds, and dwelled in mountains in the Wilderness of Ziph. Saul sought him every day, but God did not give him into his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life. And David was in the Wilderness of Ziph in Horesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan, the son of Saul, arose and went to David at Horesh. And he strengthened his hand in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Do not fear, for the hand of Saul my father will not find you. You will be king over Israel, and I will be next to you. Saul my father knows this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two of them made a covenant before the Lord. And David stayed in Horesh, but Jonathan went to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Ziphites went up to Saul to Gibeah saying, “Is David not hiding himself with us in strongholds in Horesh, on the hill of Hakilah, which is south of Jeshimon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, O king, come down according to all the desire of your soul to come down. And our part will be to deliver him into the king’s hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul said, “Blessed are you of the Lord. For you have had compassion on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please go, make sure again. Investigate and see the place where his foot rests, and who has seen him there. For it has been said to me that he is very cunning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So look and learn about all the hiding places where he hides himself. And come to me with certainty, and I will go with you. And it will be that if he is in the land, then I will track him throughout all the clans of Judah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they arose and went to Ziph before Saul. But David and his men were in the Wilderness of Maon, in the desert south of Jeshimon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul and his men went to seek him, but they told David. Therefore he came down to the Rock, and lived in the Wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued after David in the Wilderness of Maon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul went on this side of the mountain and David and his men on that side of the mountain. And David hurried to get away from Saul. Now Saul and his men were closing in on David and his men to capture them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a messenger came to Saul saying, “Hurry and go! For the Philistines have invaded the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul returned from pursuing after David, and he went against the Philistines. Therefore they called that place the Rock of Escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David then went up from there and lived in the strongholds of En Gedi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul had returned from following the Philistines, it was reported to him, saying, “David is in the Wilderness of En Gedi.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel and went to seek David and his men in front of the rocks of the wild goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to the sheep pens by the way and a cave was there. And Saul went in to relieve himself. Now David and his men were sitting in the rear of the cave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of David said to him, “This is the day of which the Lord said to you, ‘I am giving your enemy into your hand. You may do with him as seems good in your eyes.’ ” Then David arose and secretly cut off the corner of Saul’s robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward David’s heart troubled him because he had cut off a corner of Saul’s robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his men, “The Lord forbid that I should do this thing to my lord, the Lord’s anointed, to stretch out my hand against him. For he is anointed of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David dispersed his men by these words and did not let them rise against Saul. And Saul arose from the cave and went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David arose afterward and went out from the cave. And he called after Saul saying, “My lord the king!” And when Saul looked behind him, David had bowed down with his face to the ground and paid homage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Saul, “Why do you listen to the words of men saying, ‘David seeks your harm’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day you have seen with your own eyes that the Lord delivered you today into my hand in the cave. So that some said to kill you, but my eye had compassion on you. And I said, ‘I will not put forth my hand against my lord, for he is anointed of the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, my father! Look at the corner of your robe in my hand. Indeed, I cut off the corner of your robe, but I did not kill you. Observe and see that there is no evil or rebellion in my hand. I have not sinned against you, but you are lying in wait for my life to take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will judge between me and you, and the Lord will avenge me on you, but my hand will not be against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the proverb of the ancients says, ‘From the wicked comes forth wickedness,’ but my hand will not be against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After whom has the king of Israel come out? After whom are you pursuing? After a dead dog? A single flea?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord be judge, and decide between me and you. And may He see and plead my case, and deliver me out of your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David finished speaking these words to Saul, Saul said, “Is this your voice, my son David?” And Saul lifted up his voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to David, “You are more righteous than I. For you have rewarded me with good, while I have rewarded you with evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you have shown today that you have dealt well with me, when the Lord delivered me into your hand and you did not kill me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him safely go away? Therefore may the Lord reward you well for what you have done for me this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, listen, I know that you will surely be king and that the kingdom of Israel will be established in your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore swear to me now by the Lord that you will not cut off my descendants after me and that you will not destroy my name out of my father’s household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David swore to Saul and Saul went home. But David and his men went up to the stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Samuel died. And all the children of Israel gathered together and mourned him, and they buried him at his home in Ramah. Then David arose and went down to the Wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man in Maon whose work was in Carmel. He was a rich man with three thousand sheep and a thousand goats, and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man’s name was Nabal and the name of his wife Abigail. She was a woman of good understanding and beautiful, but the man was harsh and evil in his actions and he was a Calebite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David heard in the wilderness that Nabal was shearing his sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David sent out ten young men, and David said to the young men, “Go up to Carmel, and go to Nabal and greet him in my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus you will you say to him who lives in prosperity, ‘Peace be to you and peace to your house, and to all that you have, peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘I have heard that you have shearers. Now your shepherds were with us. We did not harm them nor did they miss anything all the days they were in Carmel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ask your young men and they will tell you. Therefore let my young men find favor in your eyes, for we have come on a good day. Please give whatever you find at hand to your servants, and to your son David.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David’s young men came, they spoke to Nabal according to all these words in the name of David, then they waited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nabal answered David’s servants, and said, “Who is David? And who is the son of Jesse? Today many servants are breaking away each one from his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should I then take my bread, and my water, and my meat, that which I have killed for my shearers, and give it to men whose origins are unknown?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David’s young men turned themselves around and went back. And they came and reported to him all these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to his men, “Each man strap on his sword.” And each man strapped on his sword. David also put on his sword, and four hundred men went up after David. But two hundred stayed with the baggage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, “Listen, David sent messengers out of the wilderness to bless our master; and he railed against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men were very good to us, and we were not harmed, nor did we miss anything, all the days we went about with them in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were a wall to us both by night and day, all the days we were with them keeping the flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore know and consider what you will do, for evil is determined against our master and against all his household. He is such a worthless man that one cannot speak to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abigail hurried and took two hundred loaves, two bottles of wine, five prepared sheep, five measures of roasted grain, a hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and she loaded them on donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to her servants, “Go on before me. See, I will be coming after you.” But she did not tell her husband Nabal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as she was riding on the donkey and going down into the cover of the mountain, David and his men were coming down to meet her and she met them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David had said, “Surely in vain have I guarded all that this man has in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that belonged to him. And he has returned me evil for good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So may God do unto the enemies of David and more also, if by morning I leave even one male of all who belong to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abigail saw David, she hurriedly got down from the donkey and fell before David upon her face. And she bowed herself to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she fell at his feet and said, “Against me alone, my lord, is the guilt. Please let your handmaid speak in your ears, and hear the words of your handmaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please do not let my lord set his heart against this worthless man, against Nabal. For as his name is, so is he. Nabal is his name and folly is with him. But I, your handmaid, did not see the young men of my lord, whom you sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now my lord, as the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, because the Lord has restrained you from coming in bloodshed and from avenging yourself with your own hand, now let your enemies, and those seeking to do evil to my lord, be as Nabal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now let this blessing which your maidservant has brought to my lord be given to the young men who follow my lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please forgive the transgression of your handmaid, for the Lord will certainly make my lord a sure house, because my lord fights the battles of the Lord, and evil will not be found in you all your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if a man rises to pursue you and to seek your life, the life of my lord will be bound in the bundle of the living with the Lord your God. But the lives of your enemies He will sling out, as from the hollow of a sling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be, when the Lord does for my lord according to all the good that He has spoken concerning you and has appointed you ruler over Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that this will be no grief to you, nor an offense of heart to my lord, either that you have shed blood without cause, or that my lord has avenged himself. But when the Lord has dealt well with my lord, then remember your handmaid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Abigail, “Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is your discretion, and blessed are you who have kept me this day from coming to shed blood and from avenging myself with my own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Lord, the God of Israel lives, who has restrained me from injuring you, if you had not hurried to come and meet me, surely there would not have been left even one male to Nabal by the morning light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David received from her hand what she had brought him and said to her, “Go up in peace to your house. See, I have obeyed your voice, and have granted your request.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abigail came to Nabal, and he was feasting in his house, like the feast of a king. And Nabal’s heart was merry within him, for he was very drunk. Therefore she told him nothing until the morning light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the morning when the wine was gone out of Nabal, his wife told him these things. And his heart died within him, and he became as a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about ten days after that, the Lord struck Nabal and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, “Blessed is the Lord, who has defended the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and has kept His servant from evil. For the Lord has returned the wickedness of Nabal upon his own head.”
And David sent and spoke with Abigail, to take her as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the servants of David came to Abigail at Carmel, they spoke to her, saying, “David has sent us to you to take you as his wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She arose, and bowed herself on her face to the ground, and said, “Here is your handmaid, a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abigail hurriedly arose and rode on a donkey with her five young women who attended her. And she went after the messengers of David and became his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel. So both of them were his wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Paltiel the son of Laish who was from Gallim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah, saying, “Is David not hiding himself on the hill of Hakilah, which is before Jeshimon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul arose and went down to the Wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the Wilderness of Ziph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul camped on the hill of Hakilah, which is before Jeshimon, by the road. But David stayed in the wilderness, when he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David sent out spies and knew that Saul had certainly come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David arose and came to the place where Saul had camped. And David saw the place where Saul was lying down and Abner son of Ner, the commander of his army. Saul was lying down in the encampment, while the people encamped around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then David answered and said to Ahimelek the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, saying, “Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp?”
And Abishai said, “I will go down with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and Abishai came to the people by night while Saul lay sleeping within the circle of the camp. And his spear was stuck in the ground at his head, and Abner and the people were lying all around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abishai said to David, “God has today delivered your enemy into your hand. Now please let me strike him with the spear through to the ground with one stroke, and I will not strike him a second time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Abishai, “Do not destroy him. For who can stretch out his hand against the Lord’s anointed and remain unpunished?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “As the Lord lives, the Lord will strike him, or his day will come to die, or he will go down into battle and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord forbid that I should stretch out my hand against the Lord’s anointed, but now please take the spear that is at his head and the jug of water, and let us go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David took the spear and the jug of water from Saul’s head and they went away. No one saw, no one knew, and no one awoke, for they were all asleep, because a deep sleep from the Lord had fallen upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David went over to the other side and stood on the top of a hill at a distance. A great space was between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And David called to the people and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, “Will you not answer, Abner?”
Then Abner answered and said, “Who are you that calls to the king?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Abner, “Are you not a man? And who is like to you in Israel? Why then have you not guarded your lord the king? For one of the people came in to destroy the king your lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This thing is not good which you have done. As the Lord lives, you are worthy of death because you have not guarded your master, the Lord’s anointed. And now, see where is the king’s spear? And the jug of water that was at his head?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul knew David’s voice, and said, “Is this your voice, my son David?”
And David said, “It is my voice, my lord king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Why is my lord pursuing after his servant? For what have I done? Or what evil is in my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now please let my lord king hear the words of his servant. If the Lord has stirred you up against me, let Him accept an offering. But if it was the sons of men, cursed are they before the Lord. For they have driven me today from having a share in the inheritance of the Lord, saying, ‘Go, serve other gods.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now do not let my blood fall to the ground away from the presence of the Lord. Truly the king of Israel has come out to seek a single flea, as when one pursues a partridge in the mountains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Saul, “I have sinned. Return, my son David, for I will not harm you again, because my soul was precious in your eyes this day. I have acted foolishly and have seriously gone astray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David answered and said, “See, the king’s spear! Let one of the young men come over and get it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord requites to every man his right conduct and loyalty. So the Lord gave you into my hand today, but I am not willing to stretch my hand against the Lord’s anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As your life was highly valued in my eyes this day, so may my life be highly valued in the eyes of the Lord, and may He rescue me out of all distress.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Saul said to David, “Blessed are you, my son David. You will do great things, and will surely prevail.”
So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said in his heart, “Now I will perish one day by the hand of Saul. There is nothing better for me than that I should escape to the land of the Philistines. Then Saul will despair of continually seeking me within all the territory of Israel. So will I escape out of his hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David arose and passed over with the six hundred men that were with him to Achish, the son of Maok, king of Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David lived with Achish at Gath, he and his men, each man with his household, even David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the Carmelitess, Nabal’s widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was reported to Saul that David had fled to Gath, so he no longer sought him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Achish, “If I have now found favor in your eyes, let them give me a place in one of the cities in the countryside, that I may dwell there. For why should your servant dwell in the royal city with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Achish gave him Ziklag that day. Therefore Ziklag has belonged to the kings of Judah to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of days that David lived in the country of the Philistines was a year and four months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and his men went up and invaded the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites. For they were inhabitants of the land from of old, as you come to Shur, even to the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David would strike the land and would not leave either man or woman alive. And he would take the sheep, the cattle, the donkeys, the camels, and the garments. And then he came back to Achish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Achish would say, “Where have you made a raid today?” And David would say, “Against the Negev of Judah,” or “Against the Negev of the Jerahmeelites,” or “Against the Negev of the Kenites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David would leave neither a man nor a woman alive, to bring tidings to Gath, saying, “Lest they should tell on us, saying, ‘Thus David has done.’ ” This was his practice all the days which he lived in the country of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Achish believed David, saying, “He has surely become a stench to his people Israel. Therefore he will be my servant forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came about in those days, that the Philistines gathered their armies together for war to fight with Israel. And Achish said to David, “Know assuredly that you will go out with me to battle, you and your men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David said to Achish, “Surely you will know what your servant can do.”
And Achish said to David, “Therefore I will appoint you my bodyguard for life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Samuel died and all Israel mourned him, and they buried him in Ramah, his own city. And Saul had removed the mediums and the necromancers from the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Philistines gathered themselves together. And they came and camped in Shunem. So Saul gathered all Israel together, and they camped in Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul saw the camp of the Philistines, he was afraid and his heart trembled greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul inquired of the Lord, but the Lord did not answer him by dreams, or by lots, or by prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then said Saul to his servants, “Seek for me a woman who is a medium, that I may go to her and inquire of her.”
And his servants said to him, “There is woman medium in Endor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul disguised himself, put on other clothes, and he went with two of his men. And they came to the woman by night and he said, “Please divine for me by a spirit, and bring up for me whom I will name to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Listen, you know what Saul has done, how he has eliminated the mediums and necromancers from the land. Now why are you laying a trap for my life to cause my death?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul swore to her by the Lord, saying, “As the Lord lives, no punishment will happen to you for this thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then said the woman, “Whom shall I bring up for you?”
And he said, “Bring up Samuel for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw Samuel, she cried out with a loud voice. And the woman said to Saul, “Why have you deceived me? For you are Saul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king said to her, “Do not be afraid. What did you see?”
And the woman said to Saul, “I saw a divine being ascending out of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to her, “What is his appearance?”
And she said, “An old man is coming up, and he is covered with a robe.”
And Saul perceived that it was Samuel. And he kneeled with his face to the ground and bowed himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Samuel said to Saul, “Why have you roused me to bring me up?”
And Saul answered, “I am greatly distressed, for the Philistines make war against me, and God has departed from me and does not answer me any longer by prophets or by dreams. Therefore I have called you that you might make known to me what I should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Samuel, “Why then do you ask me, since the Lord has departed from you and has become your enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has done for Himself as He spoke by me. The Lord has torn the kingdom from your hand and has given it to your neighbor, David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you did not obey the voice of the Lord and did not carry out His fierce wrath against Amalek, therefore the Lord has done this thing to you this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And moreover, the Lord will deliver Israel with you into the hand of the Philistines, and tomorrow you and your sons will be with me. The Lord will also deliver the army of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul immediately fell full length upon the ground because he greatly feared the words of Samuel. Also there was no strength in him, for he had eaten no bread all day and all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman came to Saul and saw that he was terrified. And she said to him, “Listen, your handmaid has obeyed your voice. I have taken my life in my hand and have listened to your words which you spoke to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore you also, please obey the voice of your maidservant and let me set before you a piece of bread, and eat so that you may have strength when you go on your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he refused and said, “I will not eat.”
But his servants, and also the woman, urged him and he listened to them. So he arose from the ground and sat on the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the woman had a fattened calf in the house, and she hurried and killed it, and took flour, and kneaded it, and baked unleavened bread from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She brought it before Saul and his servants, and they ate. Then they arose and went away that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines gathered together all their armies to Aphek, and the children of Israel were camping by the spring which is in Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lords of the Philistines were advancing by hundreds and by thousands, and David and his men were advancing in the rear with Achish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the princes of the Philistines said, “What are these Hebrews doing here?”
And Achish said to the princes of the Philistines, “Is this not David, the servant of Saul, king of Israel, who has been with me these days, or rather these years? And I have found no fault in him since the day of his desertion to this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the princes of the Philistines became angry with him. And the princes of the Philistines said to him, “Make this man return and let him go again to his place which you have appointed him. He will not go down with us in battle, lest he might be an adversary to us in the battle. For with what could he make himself acceptable to his master, if not with the heads of these men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this not David, whom they sing for in dances saying,
‘Saul has slain his thousands,
    and David his ten thousands’? ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Achish called David and said to him, “As the Lord lives, you have been upright, and your going out and your coming in with me in the camp has been pleasing in my sight. For I have not found evil in you since the day of your coming to me to this day. However, you are not acceptable in the eyes of the lords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now, return and go in peace, that you do not displease the lords of the Philistines.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Achish, “But what have I done? And what have you found in your servant, from the day which I came before you to this day, that I may not come and fight against the enemies of my lord the king?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Achish answered and said to David, “I know that you are pleasing in my sight like an angel of God. However the lords of the Philistines have said, ‘He shall not go up with us in battle.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore rise up early in the morning with your master’s servants who have come with you. And when you have risen early in the morning and it is light, then depart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and his men rose early to depart in the morning and return to the land of the Philistines. But the Philistines went up to Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when David and his men came to Ziklag on the third day, the Amalekites had raided the south as far as Ziklag. They had struck Ziklag and burned it with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had taken as captives all the women who were there. They did not kill anyone, but carried them off and went on their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and his men came to the city, and they found it burned with fire, and their wives, their sons, and their daughters taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and the people that were with him lifted up their voice and wept until they had no strength in them to weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David’s two wives were taken captive, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was greatly distressed, for the people talked of stoning him, because all the people were bitter in spirit, each over his sons and daughters. But David encouraged himself in the Lord his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelek, “Please bring the ephod to me.” So Abiathar brought the ephod to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David inquired at the Lord, saying, “Should I pursue after this raiding party? Will I overtake them?”
And He answered him, “Pursue them, for you will surely overtake them and will surely recover all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went, he and the six hundred men who were with him. And they came to the brook Besor, where those that were left behind remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David pursued, he and four hundred men, for two hundred who were too exhausted to cross over the brook Besor remained behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found an Egyptian in the field and took him to David. He gave him bread and he ate, and they made him drink water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave him a part of a cake of figs and two cakes of raisins. When he had eaten, his spirit came back to him, for he had not eaten bread or drunk any water for three days and nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then David said to him, “To whom do you belong? And where are you from?”
And he said, “I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite. And my master left me, because three days ago I fell sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We raided the south of the Kerethites, the south of Judah, and the south of Caleb. And we burned Ziklag with fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David said to him, “Will you bring me down to this raiding party?”
And he said, “Swear to me by God that you will neither kill me, nor deliver me into the hand of my master, and I will bring you down to this raiding party.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he brought him down, they were spread out over all the land, eating, drinking, and dancing, because of all the great spoil which they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David struck them from twilight until the evening of the next day, and no man escaped except four hundred young men who rode on camels and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David recovered all that the Amalekites had taken, and David rescued his two wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was nothing missing, from the smallest thing to the greatest, neither sons, nor daughters, or plunder, or anything which they had taken. David brought back all of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took all the flocks and the herds, which they drove before the other livestock. And they said, “This is David’s spoil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David came to the two hundred men, who were too exhausted to follow David, whom they left at the brook Besor. And they went out to meet David and the people who were with him. And when David came near to the people, he greeted them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the wicked and worthless ones from the men who went with David answered and said, “Because they did not go with us, we will not give them anything from the spoil that we have rescued, except to every man his wife and his children, that they may lead them away and depart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “You will not do so, my brothers, with what the Lord has given us, for He has preserved us, and has delivered into our hand the raiding party that came against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who will listen to you in this matter? Indeed as the share is of the one going down to battle, so will be the share of the one staying with the equipment. They will share equally.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was so from that day forward, that he set it as a statute and an ordinance for Israel to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David came to Ziklag, he sent part of the spoil to his friends, the elders of Judah, saying, “Here is a gift to you from the spoil of the enemies of the Lord”:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to those who were in Bethel, in Ramoth of the Negev, and in Jattir;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to those who were in Aroer, Siphmoth, Eshtemoa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Rakal; to those who were in the cities of the Jerahmeelites and the Kenites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to those who were in Hormah, Bor Ashan, Athak
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Hebron; and to those who were in all the other places where David and his men had roamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines were fighting against Israel, and Israel’s fighting men fled before the Philistines and they fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines overtook Saul and his sons. And the Philistines killed his sons, Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malki-Shua, Saul’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The battle was heavy against Saul. The archers found him, and he was severely wounded by the archers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through and abuse me.”
But his armor bearer would not, for he was very afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword and fell upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell upon his sword and died with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul died with his three sons and his armor bearer, together with all his men on that same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel’s fighting men who were on the other side of the valley, and those who were on the other side of the Jordan, saw that Israel’s fighting men fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned the cities and fled. So the Philistines came and lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cut off his head, stripped off his armor, and sent them into the land of the Philistines round about, to make it known in the house of their idols and among their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put his armor in the house of Ashtoreth, and they fastened his body to the wall of Beth Shan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the valiant men arose and went all night, and they took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Beth Shan, and they came to Jabesh and burned them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took their bones and buried them under the tamarisk tree at Jabesh, and they mourned, fasting seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
